channel.title: How To Port Forward
channel.description:
Ok..... My Comp Cant PortForward Cuz i dont know the PassWord my Mom Or Sister Changed it.... but i PortForwarded for my Friend
Heres How To PortForward
1. Click |Start| 2. Click Run... 3.Enter CMD 4.Enter IPCONFIG 5.Get The GateWay Ip 6.Make a New Screen And Put The GateWay Ip In It 7.A Thing Will Ask You For a Name And Pass 8. The Name Is "ADMIN" And The PassWord Is "PASSWORD" Or If That Doesnt Work Put The PassWord As "ADMIN" And it will Work.... 9.Then Youve PortForwarded......

item.title: How To Port Forward
item.dc:creator: @suomirunee suomirunee
item.description:
@suomirunee wrote:

[quote=“ZigglyScape, post:1, topic:224560”]Ok… My Comp Cant PortForward Cuz i dont know the PassWord my Mom Or Sister Changed it… but i PortForwarded for my Friend

Heres How To PortForward

  1. Click |Start|
  2. Click Run…
    3.Enter CMD
    4.Enter IPCONFIG
    5.Get The GateWay Ip
    6.Make a New Screen And Put The GateWay Ip In It
    7.A Thing Will Ask You For a Name And Pass
  3. The Name Is “ADMIN” And The PassWord Is “PASSWORD” Or If That Doesnt Work Put The PassWord As “ADMIN” And it will Work…
    9.Then Youve PortForwarded…[/quote]
    I don’t need to do that I did it to me and my friend this way: I opened up windows firewall and made so it lets 43594 port connect and I also made that it let’s runserver.bat acess to internet, that’s easy portforwarding.

And yes, major this is in wrong section.

Read full topic

Ok… My Comp Cant PortForward Cuz i dont know the PassWord my Mom Or Sister Changed it… but i PortForwarded for my Friend

Heres How To PortForward

  2. Click Run…
